humanMachineDialogue.author: Memory Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text: The report provides the maximum size of the tumor as 3.4 cm. Based on the rules provided, a T3 tumor is defined as one that is larger than 5 cm. However, the rules also state that for invasive ductal carcinoma, the T stage is based on the largest tumor size, ignoring any substaging information. Therefore, since the tumor is larger than 2 cm but not larger than 5 cm, the T stage would be T3.

humanMachineDialogue.author: ZS Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text: The T stage for breast cancer is determined by the size of the tumor and whether it has invaded the chest wall or skin. In this report, the tumor measures a maximum of 3.4 cm, which puts it in the T3 category (T3: tumor size > 5 cm). The report also mentions 'carcinomatous lymphangitis,' which is the spread of cancer to the lymphatic vessels, but it does not specify invasion of the chest wall or skin. Therefore, based on the information provided, the T stage is T3.
